intro: Evax anatolica, commonly known as the Anatolian evax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
